meanings.definition: To strike or pick at something with a beak or similar instrument.
meanings.sent1: The bird was pecking at the seeds on the ground.
meanings.sent2: She saw the woodpecker pecking at the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The chicken kept pecking at the shiny pebble, thinking it was food.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's chisel was pecking away at the block of marble.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops were pecking on the window, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: To make a series of quick, light taps or strokes.
meanings.sent1: He was pecking on the keyboard to type a message.
meanings.sent2: The drummer was pecking the drumsticks with precision.
meanings.sent3: The woodpecker was pecking on the tree in a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers were pecking on the touch screen to play a game.
meanings.sent5: The rain was pecking softly on the roof, lulling them to sleep.

meanings.definition: To eat food in small bites.
meanings.sent1: The toddler was pecking at the sandwich during lunch.
meanings.sent2: The birds were pecking at the crumbs left on the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent3: She was pecking at the salad, trying to avoid the tomatoes.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was pecking at the nuts hidden in the grass.
meanings.sent5: The children were pecking at the cookies, savoring each bite.
